courses.title: Learning Hokkinese/ Southern Min through Poems and Songs
courses.description:
An elementary course designed for students who are interested in language and culture in Taiwan and Southern Fujian.

Course content includes sounds and tones, simple daily conversation, traditional and popular songs, as well as ancient and modern poetry. Classroom activities include 1. Comparing and analysing the differences in pronunciation, vocabulary and grammar of Hokkinese/ Southern Min, Cantonese and Putonghua; 2. Song appreciation; 3. Poetry appreciation and recitation. This course will also help learners understand Taiwan and Southern Min culture, and understand Putonghua with a Hokkinese/ Southern Min accent better.
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Comparison of pronunciation, vocabulary and grammar, and song appreciation (Teresa Teng, Fong Fei-fei, Lo Ta-yu, Harlam Yu)
2. Comparison of pronunciation, vocabulary and grammar, and song appreciation (Fei Yuqing, Jody Chiang, Eric Moo, Kulilay Amit)
3. Comparison of pronunciation, vocabulary and grammar, and song appreciation (Li Yasha, Wu Bai, Mayday, The Last Day of Summer, 831)
4. Comparison of pronunciation, vocabulary and grammar, and poetry recitation (Book of Songs, Chu Ci)
5. Comparison of pronunciation, vocabulary and grammar, and poetry recitation (Yuefu poetry, Fu)
6. Comparison of pronunciation, vocabulary and grammar, and poetry recitation (gushi, regulated verse)
7. Comparison of pronunciation, vocabulary and grammar, and poetry recitation (Song Ci, Yuan Opera)
8. Comparison of pronunciation, vocabulary and grammar, and poetry recitation (Modern Chinese poetry)
